website_summaries.verdict: An intuitive drum pad set that features an 254 impressive sounds that can be allocated to different pads. Easy record option for capturing beats and a workable interface.
pros: Features eight drum heads and two foot pedals
Each head and pedal can be assigned different samples or use preset kits straight from the box
Aux in function allows you to connect your MP3 player or other device to play along to
We love the Latin drum hand percussion mode
cons: The pad sensitivity can be inconsistent

customer_reviews.title: Meh...I would suggest to get a full non-portable electronic kit.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't accurate when I used it. Seems like just about every time I used the snare, the low tom would also activate, perhaps just a defect with mine. Also, it's not worth it. The pedals were extremely cheap, and you'll just end up purchasing additional equipment to appease yourself rather than just saving your money for a full electronic kit like the Nitro Kit.
customer_reviews.author: TNBT

customer_reviews.title: So they only useful thing is the head phone and DC cord
customer_reviews.text: The expansion set that comes with it is for a keyboard. So they only useful thing is the head phone and DC cord. All of the other free help, Internet memberships and disc programs are unusable with the drum set. Otherwise it's a pretty okay set. The sounds is nice and the pressure sensitivity gives you a more real life feel and sounds. Lots of options for different drum types!!
customer_reviews.author: KayQuest

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with what's in the box and all the features.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice portable drum pad. It has over 100 different tones. Comes with a headset, I found the headset so useful when I am playing the drum at night. No one would complain me anymore. And they included a 1/8'' to 1/4'' adapter, which can be used to connect to any 1/8'' headphone jack! I strongly recommend this drum pad for a beginner who wants to learn how to play drum And people couldn't afford the acoustic drum kit or use this drum pad for rehearsals!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound for a small investment
customer_reviews.text: My son (and I) really enjoy the drum kit. Good sound, even without an amp and the pad contact is pretty reliable especially with a snare stand mount. As stated, the base pedals aren't the best but are usable. Nice to make a small investment and get to experience drumming for a beginner. The kit still works, despite the headphones breaking (stepped on-not Yamaha's fault) but those are easily replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Review4you

customer_reviews.title: Curious about electronic drums?
customer_reviews.text: This is an affordable entry-level electronic drum set. When I purchased this set I'd had my eyes on a few different models and ultimately settled on this one once a reasonable price surfaced on one. A quick YouTube search will reveal videos which showcase the FULL potential of this set (username "julianondrumsify" in particular.) The hi-hat pedal is not super responsive (though this might just be my unit/footswitch) and there's occasionally some vibratory beed-over to adjacent pads when you're hitting them with force, but again, this is a great beginner unit. If you get one and like it, but want more out of your drums - then consider upgrading to a more pro-style e-drums kit.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Best price Anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I found just the drums elsewhere for more money but with a 25% off coupon which made them a lot less expensive but then looked closer and realized it did not come with the power supply, foot pedals, drum sticks and headphones. The power supply alone is $29.99. The pedals are probably $20 each and the headphones another $20-$30 so adding that all up and taking the 25% off it still comes out $50 more expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable sounds and handy to carry
customer_reviews.text: No comparison to the real drums, or a full size digital drum sets. But, it is compact, and can be easily carried around. No volume control on individual pad. There is only one voice for the cowbell, which sounds tiny. You have to hit accurately on the small pads, and have to hit not too hard. Buy a Yamaha kick pedal and a high hat pedal to replace the ones come with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph 965

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - great size - great value
customer_reviews.text: I have been a drummer my entire life. I play a nice set of old, regular drums. Now With the DD-65 I set up in less than 5 minutes and am ready to go. I use a Fender Amplifier and with the controls on each unit I get the exact sound I want. The DD-65 has recesses on the bottom that fit a snare drum stand and it makes it very comfortable to use. The sound options are tremendous , I will spend many hours discovering more things ithe unit can do. It makes no since to me to buy a big electronic set when this small unit does so well.
customer_reviews.author: Ray R. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Not a serious drumming tool.
customer_reviews.text: After watching many YOU TUBE videos demonstrating this item, I figured I could use it to create my own backing rhythms for my guitar playing. Well...that was a mistake. I could not discern any change in the loudness of sounds no matter how hard of soft I hit the pads. Also, the kick-drum pedal kept skipping. It was returned the next day.
customer_reviews.author: JohnP

customer_reviews.title: A well made, great sounding affordable Digital Drum Pad Kit.
customer_reviews.text: This Yamaha Digital Drum Pad kit sounds like the real thing. it takes up very little space has lot's of different 'kit's and is very easy to play. I have a small recording 'studio' at home and simply did not have enough room for any drum kit, this solves the problem. It's extremely affordable, is well built (hey it's Yamaha), and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT MY GRANDSON NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for my 9 yr old drummer. He enjoys practicing without getting everyone else upset with the noise. The headphones are GREAT! The unit comes with several pre-recorded practice songs and multi sound effects that keep it very interesting. The head phones that were sent with the unit did not have the correct plugin connection and I had to get an adapter to connect them. Overall, it is a very good alternative to a regular trap set and is mobile and travels easily.
customer_reviews.author: bertamko

customer_reviews.title: Great Starting electric drum set
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is one of the better sets that you can customize and play with headphones on. I did most of my reviews by watching people on you tube playing this set, and it is a great one to play on. The sounds are crisp and clear, and the response is accurate. It doesn't have multiple hit zones per pad, but it is pressure sensitive so it can detect a hard from a soft hit. Overall, this is a great set for a kid or someone wanting to learn to play on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Katayama

customer_reviews.title: A good buy especially for practice during off hours...
customer_reviews.text: The high hat and base pedals could be more robust but the overall sound is great. We live in a townhome and have two kids this allows me to practice drills and rehearse for the weekends in off hours when the little ones are asleep. Lots of fun settings to play around with for recording or just trying new effects. Overall I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tirzah M. McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Got this as my first electric kit and was impressed with the features. Good middle ground between the more expensive kits if your a more casual drummer. Plenty of premade kits, sounds, songs, settings. Pads feel nice. Pedals are probably the worst part but can be replaced and are alright when you get used to them. Hesitated on getting an electric kit for a while and am super happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: great entertainment. and useful for just hearing what it ...
customer_reviews.text: great entertainment. and useful for just hearing what it sound like when you practice. has a Metrodome built in, that is useful as well. Keep count and helps keep your timing. Can NOT replace a drum set. the action is dead....so practicing rudiments is useless
customer_reviews.author: Hk45tack

customer_reviews.title: Drum sticks, power cord, manual and 2 pedals were supposed to come with kitI purchased the complete kit - Drum sticks, power ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the complete kit - Drum sticks, power cord, manual and 2 pedals were supposed to come with kit, and did not. The box says these items are inside, but they're not. What's really strange is the packing foam didn't even have indentations to hold the a fore mentioned items. Side note: I ordered it Sat. night and received it Mon at noon - that much was great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Bertucci

customer_reviews.title: This set is almost good enough for a beginning drummer
customer_reviews.text: This set is almost good enough for a beginning drummer, or to be a super portable kit for an experienced drummer, but the pedals are lousy, and you have to choose full sets of pre programmed drums, none of which are quite right, instead of being able to mix and match.
customer_reviews.author: William Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: I am mainly a guitar player but love to play around with drum beats
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying this. I am mainly a guitar player but love to play around with drum beats. I mostly play using MIDI into my computer. The on-board speakers are not that great but it sounds real good through headphones or external speakers with low end.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great package deal
customer_reviews.text: Great package deal. Still experimenting but goods awesome through bass amp. I don't know why some said it does not have internal speakers - I used them at first to try it out. There is an internal/external speaker utility as mentioned in the manual. Made pedal board out of plywood for better activation as per youtube tip. Using Yamaha snare stand to mount unit - seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N.

customer_reviews.title: quick review: very very good (but not perfect) replacement for Rock Band drums
customer_reviews.text: the touch of this drum kit is utterly sublime compared to the fairly fatiguing (but decently quiet) Rock Band 2 pads. however along with that, your drumsticks bounce a bit more (making you do an extra hit in-game and breaking combos). that's not my complaint. mine is that it's a bit small compared to the RB2 pads and as a result i've been missing hits on fast and furious songs. i guess i'd actually give this 4.3 or 4.5 stars, but you can't give half stars.
customer_reviews.author: plonk420

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a compromise
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to have a full-size electronic kit, but this will have to do for now. It's smaller than I expected and takes more effort to play. The good news is that the sounds are pretty good when I plug it into a good amp. And my kids enjoy banging away on it to make some noise. For the price, it'll get me by for now.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Practice Set
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a drummer but I am a singer/song writer and occasionally need to add some fill-in drums in my recordings. This electronic pad is easy to use, intuitive, and great for the price. If you are a serious drummer I would look for something more advanced. However, for practicing and simple drum beats this is the way to go. Note: The cymbal and bass drum pedals are pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Bello

customer_reviews.title: Get this to be headache free!
customer_reviews.text: Was 1 day off on the delivery but it was the holiday season. The drum pad was just what the doctor ordered for my nephew that was continually banging on stuff. Now he can bang until his heart is content and we don't have to really hear it because of the included headphones! The product was sturdy out of the box and looks like it can withstand his destructive nature. I will update once he has gotten some months logged on it.
customer_reviews.author: M.petteway

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The sounds options are great and the feel is good. It has a lot of teaching functions which are helpful to improve rhythm and technique. Can be played with headphones which keeps the neighbors happy. I am a song writer hobbyist and have two young kids who like to bang around on things. This is durable, compact enough to store out of the way, sounds great and excellent tool to teach the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sounds great no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Was going to give 4 stars, but if it has held up to 3 kids under 7 for 2 years.... quite amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Vancouver

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice practice tool for a non-drummer like myself. However one of the pads stopped working after about 20 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Boofus D

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these and one of the power ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and one of the power cords stopped working within two weeks, for which Amazon quickly reimbursed me, but then not another two weeks later the drum pads are disfunctioning on the other as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Can NOT take a beating. Broke it twice already
customer_reviews.text: I've broken the snare pad twice already and I wasn't even laying into it like I wanted to. Love it when it worked. I've hooked it up to PreSonus Studio One.
customer_reviews.author: FPChris

customer_reviews.title: Lag. Less than thrilled with experience, even for private use
customer_reviews.text: I guess you kinda get what you pay for when you're seeing this product for <$300 and other electronic drumsets upward of $600+++. Laggy, and mine came with a dysfunctional pedal
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha DD65 Electronic Drum Pad
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the price, $40 cheaper than retail. The DD65 will certainly serve it's purpose, very versatile, of course not as responsive as the larger expensive digital kits. However the bass and high hot "pedal-buttons" are terrible. I've never seen such cheap foot controllers. It's an obvious ploy, you will be forced to upgrade to the expensive bass and high hat pefdals. Fortunately I already have them from my Roland full size digital drum kit. If you can't afford the upgrade there are much better small, inexpensive foot controllers out there.
customer_reviews.author: musician

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's got a lot of BANG for the buck !!! I'm using it mostly to play along to my favorite albums on my ipod which easily patches into the unit. I live in an apartment building and can now practice without the cops ringing the bell !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: You Will NOT Be Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound ... great build ... they work incredibly well with amplified speakers. LOTS of value for the money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Dave!

customer_reviews.title: My teenager loves it
customer_reviews.text: We auditioned several different electronic drum pads, and this one sounds the best. My 13-year-old loves it. (This is her first experience drumming though -- I don't know what a real drummer would think.) The only downside is the lousy pedals, which are just on/off switches. So we bought a real bass drum pedal (Pearl P900) and trigger pad (Yamaha KP65) and they work great for the bass drum input. We also got an Alesis RealHat to replace the hihat switch, but it double-triggers and might be defective. The DD65 fits nicely on a snare stand (Pearl S900).
customer_reviews.author: N. D. Gumby

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Product, my daughter has had this for over a year and she LOVES it.... She takes lessons and with the headphones she and her teacher hear whats going on, BUT I DON'T..... Love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sounds
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds, easy to change settings, easy to use, fits well on a snare drum stand
customer_reviews.author: Vet87

customer_reviews.title: I know he will love this set
customer_reviews.text: I buy this dram set for my sons Christmas Gift, I know he will love this set. Thanks all of you.
customer_reviews.author: Walter G.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: it's pretty awesome....except for the foot padels...and the stick is pretty light which is good thing in this case
customer_reviews.author: kyl308

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I adjusted the sound by using the built in equalizer, and it now sounds amazing. Unfortunately, my hi-hat pad stopped working within weeks after my purchase so now I must see about my warranty. Otherwise, it plays well and feels well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to a begginner with zero space for a real set.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't call this premium due to the sound quality and the pad sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: The E.

customer_reviews.title: but I have a lot of fun playing with this
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a drummer, but I have a lot of fun playing with this, and I'm picking up some hand drumming techniques
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cook

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good drum set
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good drum set. Our whole family has fun playing with it and I'm glad that we can practice without annoying everyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: It was everything I expected and the drum instructor concurs that it is a good
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Electronic Drum Pad I have purchased. It was everything I expected and the drum instructor concurs that it is a good product
customer_reviews.author: Fun In The Sun Lady

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this product. One of the floor drums did not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: jackie allison

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool. You could probably gig with it in small venues. Foot pedals aren't great however.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Bean

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I love percussion, but missed the window when I could have been a natural drummer (thanks Mrs. Crouch - trombone was a much better instrument to play than drums.). I bought this to play around with when the mood hit me. Best part is I can attach my iPod and play along to songs of my choosing. I recommend this if you have a desire to play for the fun of it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Just enough...
customer_reviews.text: Good feel to the drums, but the pedals are very basic. I was somewhat expecting more 'percussion' sounds, but there are few useful voices outside of the drum set sounds. Where is the timpani? Overall a good product with just enough to do a 'portable performance'.
customer_reviews.author: Christian M.

customer_reviews.title: I a nice tool that allows one the ability to practice and ...
customer_reviews.text: I a nice tool that allows one the ability to practice and not encroach on others . So far I very happy with it !
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mattox

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha DD65 is a great product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best packages that is truly value for money. Just one thing though.. trying to play ghost notes may be a challenge and I agree with the critics...the foot pieces can be improved, but it is not as bad as I thought considering what I heard. Overall...I enjoy it...and it gives me confidence to try something new every time I have to play in church.
customer_reviews.author: Morne Kriel

customer_reviews.title: great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's fifth birthday. I didnt want to get him a toy that broke within a few days. While this is an instrument that can be used by adults it was also easy enough to use that he and his brother picked it up very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gerig

customer_reviews.title: Sound realistic and could be used on band practices coupling it with a good amplifier. I'm using a bass amp and still ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is outstanding! Sound realistic and could be used on band practices coupling it with a good amplifier. I'm using a bass amp and still produce awesome sound. I will recommend this item to my friends and relatives!
customer_reviews.author: RUPERTO A ESPIRITU

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive way to improve rhythm.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a drummer. I bought this to improve my rhythm for guitar and piano. I use it plugged into my computer with various drum software. Great fun and better than the other options I've used at the same price level. I recommend replacing the bass pedal with a real bass pedal though.
customer_reviews.author: Music, Games and Electronics Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha and as good as I have grown to expect
customer_reviews.author: Carl J Baltes

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing deal. The DD65 is easy to use right ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing deal. The DD65 is easy to use right out of the box and has a professional sound quality. The whole family loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Strom

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The sounds are very good, and for a beginner such as myself, is very good, the only complaint i do have are the pedals, that, despite they work, they could be a bit more sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: hector manuel gomez mendez

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It's like buying hundreds of drums at once! LOVE flexibility -- to play with hands / sticks. Happy with design, quality, price.
customer_reviews.author: Sama

customer_reviews.title: The unit was highly recommended and more than we expected it to be
customer_reviews.text: The unit was highly recommended and more than we expected it to be. This was bought to give our grandson more practice without going to the garage or raising the level of noise in the house. He loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Karlata Sparling

customer_reviews.title: very nice headset allows an individual to play and not disturb
customer_reviews.text: very nice headset allows an individual to play and not disturb others
customer_reviews.author: gloria

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I'm happily surprised with the set. It a has professional look and the layout is comfortable and well thought out. With earphones you can get the full sound. Remember that while you have the phones on no one hears the music but you can hear the tapping on the pads to the naked ear. The stand is an "aw sorta". Works...but... the foot pads are kinda meek and yes will work sorta. I think for a beginner or even a professional who wants to try things out in a quietish space. This makes sense. I can't tell you how many of these things I've thrown out but this looks like a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: gatomorongo

customer_reviews.title: Affordable choice for silent learning drums
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for practice and learning. This is more for those who want to keep playing on acoustic drums. You can use your acoustic snare stand for it.
customer_reviews.author: carrilhola

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound spacer saver
customer_reviews.text: These drums are everything I was lead to believe they are. There are lots of features for a beginner and for an advanced player. I love the sound quality and the space saving size.
customer_reviews.author: SABIENE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price with the headphone and power adapter. Drums work great no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J McSpadden

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great drum kit to practice or travel. Pedals could be better.
customer_reviews.author: sebastian serrano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent instrument
customer_reviews.text: Great features for a beginner : Songs to play along, sound banks, Aux inputs, headphone, Compact. The controls are simple and intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: SUPER fun and worked perfectly for ~8 months
customer_reviews.text: SUPER fun and worked perfectly for ~8 months, but recently the crash cymbal broke. It is extremely difficult to get the pad to register at all (I never changed any settings), even if I try to manually adjust the sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A great inexpensive drum pad kit
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy for the price. Learning to drum again and this Yamaha drum pad system works very well. I feed You Tube music into it to drum along with. The pads are pressure sensitive and respond very well to how hard you hit them. I knocked it down a star because the foot pedals are junk. Order the better one (especially the kick drum) for $70 more or so.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Baker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it for the portability but having trouble finding a carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It has been fun using it both at home and with our Mathers More Than a Cafe Chorus.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas T. DeMichael

customer_reviews.title: Definitely excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Amazing sound and is the best choice for learn drums. The button of pedal 1 and 2 is rare, but is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Linero

customer_reviews.title: great gift idea
customer_reviews.text: my grandson loves the drums!!!!!!!! he plays them all day long this was a big hit i am so glad we bought it
customer_reviews.author: Louise Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drums!
customer_reviews.text: We have loved these drums! We run them through my sons mixer and play them on the PA speaker. For the price these cant be beat and are loads of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Emalee Ingram

customer_reviews.title: great kit for beginner
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Christmas for 14yr old son who plays in school. It lags a bit and trouble with the pedal other than that he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Weaver

customer_reviews.title: MISSING Power Adaptor and Headset
customer_reviews.text: Product was MISSING Power adaptor and MISSING Headset, also had to PAY to RETURN Item. Very Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: rock

customer_reviews.title: AC Adaptor is 110 V!!!
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to setup and use. The only disappointment was the included power supply which works only on 110 V! And it's not included in their specifications and seller information. Now, I will have to buy another adaptor and the included one is now a garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Totits

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift for my 11 year old
customer_reviews.text: This gift has been a total success for my eleven year old son. He is a beginner drummer but is spending hours playing with the drum sets and learning new rhythms every day. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: MARTHA C MARTINEZ

customer_reviews.title: VERY STURDY
customer_reviews.text: Im giving it 5 stars because I bought a used one and we beat on it an it dont scratch the suface.It has alot of features im just getting to now. I like it
customer_reviews.author: FCM

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is a drummer, thought he could have it close by when he didn't want to set up his full kit, the delay in the sound is crazy it doesn't work. It doesn't pick up any of the subtle hits, and it's like a delay in typing it was horrible!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Overall great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: It would be much better if the pad sensitivity could be set individually. The preset mixes are good but not always balanced. I was dissapointed that I did not receive the headphones that were supposed to be part of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ricky m.

customer_reviews.title: Fun but limited
customer_reviews.text: it is what it is; an inexpensive e-kit/glorified toy. The unit's own speakers are inadequate. I didn't try the headphones but I suspect they flesh out a big sound like when I plugged into a powered personal amp. I'm used to playing a full-sized acoustic kit so this felt like playing with handcuffs due to the small range of motion and small pads. I really missed the nuance of real heads and cymbals. It was, however, useful and fun for the small jam session I brought it to. Small, light, and different. I am returning it though as I'd rather have the money than something I'd rarely use.
customer_reviews.author: BXC

customer_reviews.title: ideal
customer_reviews.text: i needed this for my 13 yo daughter that wants to learn drums, and we don't have the loudness... Plus, it's not a toy, it's a Yamaha!
customer_reviews.author: L. LOPEZ-NIEVES

customer_reviews.title: non
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha DD 65 good and working properly but the problem is the entrance to the headphones does not function well
customer_reviews.author: non

customer_reviews.title: No AC Adapter Included
customer_reviews.text: I just opened this product and was disappointed to see that no AC Adapter was included. Most of the other sellers of this item included it. Now that I look closely over the description, I see that it did not say that it had one, but that is something I think most people would expect to be part of the accessories. So, it sits here and I can't play it until i get one. I wondered how this seller was able to sell this drum kit a little cheaper than the others. Now I know why.
customer_reviews.author: AaronM

customer_reviews.title: It is a toy not for serious hobbyists get the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a toy not for serious hobbyists get the Multi-12 a lot more money, but a serious bit of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Ron J Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived quickly and safely. My son loves his gift. Pedals are pretty flimsy, but this is for a non professional child drummer. If he likes it, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Riis

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good for a child
customer_reviews.text: I returned tis device. It's a toy. Not for anyone wanting to learn the drums. Much to small. Maybe good for a child, but not an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Trapshooter

customer_reviews.title: Drum sticks were not received as part of the package
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive the drum sticks as mentioned in the picture. Rest is all good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got this for someone learning to play drums. It was reasonably priced but also didn't take up the space a regular drum set would. Besides, what could be better than the drummer hearing what's going on with the rest of the world being blissfully unaware? Our neighbors are happy with it too! The teenager is still exploring all the capabilities but has already written the drum part to two songs their little group has written. I feel this has been a fairly inexpensive way to provide the tools necessary to stimulate an expressed interest. Besides, I got my garage and basement cleaned for getting it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Sackman

product_meta.title: Yamaha DD65 Electronic Drum Pad Premium Package with Headphones, Power Supply, Drum Sticks, and 2 Foot Pedals
product_meta.description:
Style:DD65 Premium Pack

YAMAHA DD65 PORTABLE DIGITAL DRUMS
Designed from a drummer's point of view, the DD-65 features eight touch-sensitive pads, two drum pedals, and AUX IN for playing along with your MP3 player.

DRUMMER-FRIENDLY AND STYLISH
The drummer-friendly and stylish design of the Yamaha DD-65 marks a transition to a more professional and versatile digital-drumming instrument. AUX IN jack lets you connect an MP3 player and play along with your favorite music or load MIDI songs from the Internet into the internal Flash ROM memory and play along.

WIDE VARIETY OF STEREO-SAMPLED VOICES
New stereo-sampled voices, a wide variety of percussion sounds from all over the world, a bass boost system, and digital stereo processing give the DD-65 an irresistible, thundering beat. The panel includes intuitive features that are easy to operate. For example, select the Hand Percussion mode and the kit automatically switches to percussion voices like congas and bongos. With its powerful features, this product is no toy. Anyone can enjoy it.

FEATURES
 * 8 touch-sensitive drum pads allow expressive playing 
 * AUX IN jack for connecting and playing along with an MP3 player 
 * Tempo control using Tap Start 
 * Hand percussion mode with Latin drums allows playing with hands 
 * 254 GM compatible voices assignable to any pad 
 * Two assignable foot pedals included for kick, hi-hat, or any other voice 
 * 100 built-in songs for learning and playing along 
 * 50 programmed drum kits and custom kits 
 * 32-note polyphony 
 * Reverb and Master EQ 
 * Large 3-digit LED shows selection 
 * Record your own songs (up to 5 in memory at one time) 
 * MIDI in/out for computer connectivity 
 * Headphone jack 
 * Stereo speakers with bass port provide great sound quality



FROM THE MANUFACTURER



YAMAHA DD65 ELECTRONIC DRUM PAD PREMIUM PACKAGE

This bundle gives you everything that you need right out of the box! Included are a pair of professional closed cup headphones, power supply, drum pedals, and a pair of drum sticks. The drummer-friendly and stylish design of the Yamaha DD-65 marks a transition to a more professional and versatile digital-drumming instrument. The aux in jack lets you connect an mp3 player and play along with your favorite music or load midi songs from the internet into the internal flash rom memory and play along. With new stereo-sampled voices, a wide variety of percussion sounds from all over the world, a bass boost system and digital stereo processing give the DD-65 an irresistible, thundering beat. The panel includes intuitive features that are easy to operate. for example, select the hand percussion mode and the kit automatically switches to percussion voices like congas and bongos. With its powerful features, this is no toy. Anyone can enjoy it.
